meanings.sent1: She externalizes her thoughts by writing them down.
meanings.sent2: The plant externalizes its roots to absorb nutrients from the soil.
meanings.sent3: The artist externalizes their emotions through vibrant colors on the canvas.
meanings.sent4: His laughter externalizes joy in the room, filling it with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The sun externalizes its rays, illuminating the entire sky.

meanings.definition: To attribute to an external source.
meanings.sent1: He externalizes his success to the support of his family.
meanings.sent2: The author externalizes the inspiration for her novel to her travels.
meanings.sent3: The student externalizes his lack of preparation to the noisy neighbors last night.
meanings.sent4: The chef externalizes the delicious flavors of the dish to the fresh ingredients.
meanings.sent5: The coach externalizes the team's victory to their hard work and dedication.
